intro: Dysopsis glechomoides var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy dysopsis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name "hirsuta." Its small white or greenish-white flowers are arranged in compound umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
